_header: When I am laid to sleep as for a stound
_description:
Charles d’Orléans, a balade with refrain ‘This is my slepe y falle into decay’, translated from the French (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 22) — three 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) and 4-line Envoy

BLHar682.First Lines:
WHen y am leyd to slepe as for a stoundTo haue my rest y kan in no
                    manere…
BLHar682.Last Lines:
…For with myn hurt he doth him silf achereThis is my slepe
                    yfalle as in decay
